result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
$518  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AN's family unless requested by family.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

Trial judge - Br 5
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 09:30 am. - Handed out in court on 8-29-2016

Defendant in court with Attorney Tim Kiefer and Atty Sara Wynn.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald J Green in court with attorney Tim Kiefer and Sara Wynn. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing to prepare for trial &  pre-trial motions.  Defense Motion to Exclude Expert Witness William Hendrickson.  ADA Raymond makes argument in support of expert witness. Atty Kiefer makes argument in support of his motion. Ct. rules that detective William Hendricksons testimony is excluded in States case in chief due to inadequate notice of expert.  Defense Motion for Jury Instruction Regarding Lost Probation File. Argument by Atty Kiefer in support of motion.   ADA Raymond makes argument against motion.  Ct. rules there will be no references to DOC file or Mr. Green having been on probation.  Ct. also denies alternative remedy proposed from defense to call records custodian.  ADA Raymond makes argument to exclude defense expert N.Schiavo due to late notice.  Ct. is satisfied that Mr. Schiavos expert qualifications should be allowed & rules that there has been enough notice to the State.  States Other Acts Motion: Argument in support of motion by ADA Raymond.  Argument in opposition to States other acts motion. Rebuttal argument by ADA Raymond in support of other acts motion. Rebuttal by Atty Kiefer.  Ct. grants States other acts motion.  Ct. does rule that a curative instruction to the jury will need to be given.  Ct. denies motion indicating that other acts motion witnesses is cumulative. Atty Kiefer requests the State turn over any plea offers that were presented to witness, Z.S.  ADA Raymond indicates that she is unaware of any plea offers to Z.S. but is still looking into that further to make sure.  Z.S. was never referred to DAs office as a co-defendant on this case.  ADA Raymond advises that if she shares negotiations with Z.S. she will add people to her witness list that were involved in these plea agreements.  Atty Kiefer does not object to adding those witnesses.   Ct. orders State to turn over any negotiation information regarding witness Z.S to the defense by Monday August 22nd. At trial Counsel will have 5 strikes each, 2 alternates.
